name: lithium iron phosphate production, solid state process | lithium iron phosphate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27232/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg lithium iron phosphate (LFP) via solid state process, used as active material in the production of LFP cathodes in Li-ion batteries. 

The activity starts when the chemicals enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production at factory gate of LFP active material via solid state process.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2014 (year of the publication of data) and 2025 (assuming that this producing technology is still viable in the near future)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The values in this dataset are assumed to be representative of the production of LFP in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: ;Lithium iron phosphate can be produced via hydrothermal process or solid state process. The solid state LFP synthesis process requires a lithium compound, an iron compound, and a phosphorous compound. Initially the mixture is heated at around 600°C. Then, it is cooled to room temperature. Finally, it is reheated to circa 800°C to produce the final product. ;;;;The general reaction is the following: ;3Li2CO3 + 2Fe3O4 + 6(NH4)2HPO4 → 6LiFePO4 + remainings from reaction. The remanings include ammonium carbonate and ammonium hydroxide which decompose to CO2 + NH3 and NH3 + H2O respectively, resulting in the following complete reaction: ;3Li2CO3 + 2Fe3O4 + 6(NH4)2HPO4 → 6LiFePO4 + 3CO2 + 12NH3 + 9H2O + O2 ;;Reference: ;;Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.;Toprakci, O. (2012). Advanced Nanofiber-Based Lithium-Ion Battery Cathodes. North Carolina State University. Chapter 1.5.2. Solid-state methods for LiFePO 4 production.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The data about the production process of LFP are retrieved from the literature (Dunn et al., 2014) and complemented with calculation to account for emissions during the process thus obtaining mass balance. 

Reference: 
Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on Annual production: 27000 metric ton cathode material (Dai et al., 2018); assumption 50yr lifetime chemical factory.

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.

exchanges.description:
Literature. Original value 2.531 mmBTU/ton LFP taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National LAboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dunn et al. (2014). Conversion factors: 1 mmBTU = 1,055.055853 MJ; 1 MJ = 0.27778 kWh

Reference:
Dunn, J., James, C., Gaines, L., & Gallagher, K. (2014). Material and energy flow in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries. Argonne National Laboratory.
